subject: In Slovenia
event:
Arrived from Warsaw yesterday, checked into our hotel, and immediately did a press conference and a zillion interviews.  Late afternoon, it was time to head to Koper on the Adriatic, where I did my signing.  Huge friendly turnout, including nt only Slovenes, but also fans from Croatia, Italy, and even Austria.  I signed and signed...

On the way home, we stopped at the most amazing castle, built into the mouth of a huge cave.  Definitely have to model some castle in Westeros on this one, it was an eyefull, especially by night.  I was given a personal tour, presented with a beautiful illuminated scroll, and asked to pres ny hands into wet cement, ala Mann's Chinese Theater.  And then we had the most amazing medieval Slovenian feast.

Didn't get back to the hotel until well past midnight, but it was an experience I will long treasure. 

Today I do more interviews, and another signing, this one right here in Ljubljana.  We're expecting an even bigger turnout.

It's all good.  But boy, am I tired.

comments.article:
It was awesome! You made huge impression and I am not sorry I took a trip from Ljubljana to the Coast.

Wish we had more time to chat though... Hope you`ll be shown as many sight seeings as possible during the stay, yet take some time ti chill out in some of our enchanted spots (such as Kobarid).

Again, it was really an experience!

Best wishes,

Alen
comments.subject: Been there!

comments.article: That castle sounds amazing. Any chance of seeing pictures of it? Or can you give us the name of the castle, at least?
I think it should be Predjama Castle.
Glad you had a good time. Slovenia is ever ravishing. :)

I'm very happy you got the chance to see Predjamski grad, it's probably the coolest castle in Slovenia and we have MANY castles considering we're not exactly the biggest country in existance. :)
I'm so happy you're enjoying my country (Got a taste of prsut and cvicek already? You should.). And I'm so looking forward to seeing you today! :)
Sounds amazing! What a way to be honoured (:

Glad you liked Predjama castle - it is truly something to behold. I hope they told you the story of the robber knight who used to hold it, and the siege to get him out.

Looking forward to the signing today!

I wish you could swing by Copenhagen...I know you can't, but still. :D Some friends and I tried to arrange a trip to Poland, but we just couldn't juggle work, family and Poland...poor little rabbit just didn't enjoy being tossed in the air. :D

Anyhow, enjoy your trip!
comments.subject: While you're in Europe....

comments.article: It is impossible to express how happy we are to have you here in our tiny chicken-shaped country. Can't wait for today's geek fest, erm, signing. :)
comments.subject: Welcome!

comments.article: What was the castle called? I'm passing through Slovenia this summer so would be interested to visit it!
In Slovene we call it Predjamski grad, in English it would be castle Predjama. The name comes from "pred" (in front of) and "jama" (cave).

It was amazing... Koper is beautiful and whole experience was great! Good luck with the rest of your travels and have as much fun as you had in Koper!

All best!

Thank you for a beautiful day in Koper! And of course, thank you for existing! :)

Greetings from Croatia,
Tea

According to the post from Westeros on facebook the castle is Predjama Castle.

Glad to here your trip is going well Mr. Martin hope you can get some rest soon, would not want to see you catching another super illness due to being run down.
comments.subject: Castle

comments.article:
Its Predjama castle near Postojna.
See wiki http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predjama_Castle

Woow, nice you've had some extra time to do some sightseeing :) Trust me, we'll be honored to inspire your amazing world!
See you today... Looking forward to!!!
Natasa
I was one of the Italian fans that came! I'm still shaky after meeting you! I keep looking at the dedication you wrote me to make sure it wasn't all a dream!
comments.subject: Italian Fan

comments.article:
It was awesome meeting you yesterday and thank you again for coming to our country.

Glad to see you're enjoying the visit and the sights. Since it was late you probably didn't visit the Postojna Caves while you were at the castle. Not exactly a Medieval themed sight but it could still fit very well in Westeros :D

for George to visit the caves, because he really likes caves. We've toured caves in Australia, Ireland, the USA, many visited multiple times over the years. If he didn't get to see the caves, I suspect if he ever goes back to Slovenia, the caves would be at the top of list he'd like to see.

So good to know you enjoyed going to his signing, and to all the others who have written about their experiences and put photos up on various types of internet media, thanks so much for sharing your experiences with us.
comments.subject: the schedule probably was too tight
Re: the schedule probably was too tight

comments.article:
The first time I read about the Eyrie, I imagined this same set up, only instead of being next to a cave, it sat on top of a network of paths and caves, on the inside and outside of the mountain.

The scenes with Tyrion in jail especially evoked this. I imagined that while looking down, he saw raw mountainside, but if he looked UP, he would also see raw mountainside before he saw man-made castle wall.
Why oh why is Maribor cancelled :( now i can't come :((
comments.subject: Maribor

comments.article: Well, I would have said that the castle has been quite successfully (if maybe unintentionally) used as the Helm's Deep in LotR, but you're right, it is a rather spectacular sight. It's been years since my visit to Slovenia, but I definitely remember this one :-)
comments.subject: Predjama Castle

comments.article: Predjamski grad should be the model for the castle of a wealthy old house in the Vale.  And there should be vineyards.  Okay, ignore the last part.

We're all more than glad that you're enjoying Slovenia so much! Unforunately I am stranded abroad for work, but Boštjan is supposed to pass my greetings on to you. The idea of a castle based on Predjama sounds great, hope it bears fruit ;)

Thank you so much for coming to Slovenia! I couldn't believe it when I first heard you were to come here. :) It is good to hear you are enjoying yourself here, especially the Predjamski grad - Predjama castle. It really is beautiful and I feel it made a wonderful backdrop to your interviews :D.

My feet are sore after standing for two hours, but I met you and have my autograph, yay. :) There were still A LOT of people there after I left though, so you're probably still signing at the moment while I am already resting my feet at home. I hope you get a chance to rest soon.

Just came home from the signing in Ljubljana, and i have to say it was great to finally meet you in person!
I hope you enjoyed your visit in Ljubljana.
I was really moved by your dedication in my edition of Game of Thrones, and i will treasure it forever.
Thank you for everything!
comments.subject: Thank you for your visit!

comments.article:
WELCOME!
It's great to have you in Slovenia. Me and my friends were delighted to be on your signing today in Ljubljana, although the wait was approximately 3 hours.
Hope you enjoy your stay!

I just got back from the book signing event. I was there at 17:20, took me 5 hours waiting in line to get my turn, I'm guessing Mr. Martin is still there signing all those books, I feel sorry for him as the turnout was huge.

Was a bit bummed that they canceled personal inscriptions when there were about 10 people ahead of me, mind you I don't blame the author but the organizers who should have anticipated the turnout and adjusted the number of signed books per person accordingly.

So, forgot to get a personal inscription a few years back in Zagreb and lucked out this time in Ljubljana. Third time's the charm? Hope you visit these parts again, hopefully you'll get to do more sightseeing and less signing books....
comments.subject: Ljubljana signing
